title: Lua Modules install path does not contain the correct arch
body:
When using LMod backend, the install path of the modules does not contain the architecture of the machine, while it does for the TMod.

```
$ ml av

------------------------------------ /opt/apps/spack/share/spack/lmod/linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64/Core ------------------------------------
   gcc/4.9.4    gcc/5.5.0    gcc/6.5.0    gcc/7.4.0    gcc/8.3.0    gcc/9.2.0 (D)

------------------------------------ /opt/apps/spack/share/spack/modules/linux-ubuntu18.04-skylake -------------------------------------
   gcc-7.4.0/gcc/4.9.4    gcc-7.4.0/gcc/5.5.0    gcc-7.4.0/gcc/6.5.0    gcc-7.4.0/gcc/7.4.0    gcc-7.4.0/gcc/8.3.0    gcc-7.4.0/gcc/9.2.0 (D)
```

Just to emphasize: the installation path for lua modules is
`/opt/apps/spack/share/spack/lmod/linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64/Core`, while the `tcl` modules is `/opt/apps/spack/share/spack/modules/linux-ubuntu18.04-skylake`.

### Steps to reproduce the issue
```
spack module lmod refresh -y --delete-tree
spack module tcl refresh -y --delete-tree
```
You need to module use the `lmod` module path. The `tcl` one, at least for me, is added automatically by `. $SPACK_ROOT/share/spack/setup-env.sh`.
